name: Baked BBQ Baby Back Ribs
author: Chef John
summary: If you're in the mood for a little virtual trip into summer, give this technique a try. This works with literally any dry rub and barbecue sauce combo.
ingredients: ½ teaspoon ground dried chipotle pepper
directions: Preheat oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C)
Mix ancho chile powder, white sugar, brown sugar, salt, black pepper, cumin, dry mustard, cayenne pepper, and chipotle pepper in a small bowl until combined
Place ribs meat-side down on aluminum foil
Prick back of rib rack several times with a knife
Generously apply coating of dry rub to all sides of rib rack
With rib rack meat-side down, fold foil around it to create a tight seal
Bake in preheated oven until tender and cooked through, about 2 hours
Increase oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Open foil, drain and discard any accumulated juices and fat
Brush barbeque sauce on all sides of rack
Place rack meat-side up and return to oven, leaving foil open
Bake for 10 minutes, remove from oven, and brush another layer of barbeque sauce on meat-side only
Repeat baking and brushing with sauce 4 more times, for a total of 50 minutes baking time
Cut rack into individual rib segments and serve with more barbeque sauce
